data.contents: ### triggering conditional CSS inside SVG backgrounds The <details> element here has a size of 200×200 pixels, but when opened, it has a size of 200×201 pixels (because of the .inner-spacer element). By using an SVG background that does not have a viewBox and a background-size of 100%, the browser will actually pass the size of the container to the SVG image. So, inside the SVG (module #6 LessCSS), we can check for the case where the container is larger than 200 pixels, and apply a simple animation (or a more complex animation…)
